website_summaries.verdict: While not waterproof enough for extreme winter conditions, these deerskin gloves are great for cold weather driving and easy to maintain between uses.
pros: Inner lining excels at wicking moisture
Deerskin outer shell provides solid grip on steering wheel
cons: Lining is thin, does not provide warmth
Material may not be genuine leather
Not recommended for extremely cold weather

customer_reviews.title: Great gloves. Soft, flexible, and warm.
customer_reviews.text: Had the devil of a time finding insulated gloves that would fit my husband's large hands. The XXL fit him perfectly, and were so soft. We have a farm, and these gloves kept his hands toasty warm in snow and 10-degree weather while feeding cows. The leather palms were flexible but with enough traction that it was easy to grip slippery items. He loves these gloves, and I just ordered him a second pair.
customer_reviews.author: MS Doggie Mama

customer_reviews.title: Great gloves & excellent value
customer_reviews.text: Really pleased with these gloves. I've only had them for a week, but have surely been used during the recent cold. I can attest to the gloves keeping your hands warm with temperatures in the teens. Other notes, the sizing is to the small size, so consider your order carefully. Also, these gloves are attractive enough to be worn with business professional wear. Highly recommend.
customer_reviews.author: matt

customer_reviews.title: Great Daily Use Glove.
customer_reviews.text: I'm not sure if they are minus 20 gloves or not because I've been in those conditions and I have a very different glove for that. But for daily in and out of the car and walking down the streets in Cleveland, Ohio winter these are perfect. Nice and soft and comfortable.A decent leather palm. Probably not your work glove but a good durable, very warm daily use glove. Exactly what I was looking for. Highly recommend these. I will try them winter biking which is what they are sold as and I imagine they will be great for that. Just not in Alaska. That I know. I like 'em!
customer_reviews.author: Dan Elliott

customer_reviews.title: Not warm at 37 degrees
customer_reviews.text: Got these and the first time I used them it was 37 degrees. I was visiting different work sites and getting out of the vehicle for 10-15 minutes each time. I was glad to have them instead nothing but the definitely did not keep my hands as warm as I would like. If you are active and generating some heat, maybe these gloves work in colder weather. Otherwise I would go with something else.
customer_reviews.author: Steve

customer_reviews.title: Nice for the price
customer_reviews.text: When I ordered these gloves, I did not even realize they were made with deer skin... That said, they have been a very pleasant surprise. I wear these every day walking the dogs, so they do get some wear pulling back on our naughty dogs all the time. They are soft, warm, and durable for regular daily use. Not sure if I would wear these to construct a house or something, but they make a great glove for daily use. One other comment, I also clean the snow off of my car with these, and I think another cool property of the deer skin is that they have a bit of natural water resistance. Snow and water just brushes off.
customer_reviews.author: Pittman Fam

customer_reviews.title: Will keep your hands warm in cold, dry weather to about 40 degrees, but they aren't the least bit waterproof
customer_reviews.text: I bought these gloves for my teenager son as he headed off to Worcester MA for college, thinking that they'd provide adequate warmth for his hands during their super cold winters. And they do...unless its wet or snowy, at which point the gloves become soaked through and through. These gloves look decent and are fine for temperatures at about 40 degrees or warmer in dry weather. For colder, wetter weather, choose something both waterproof and with a better heat rating.
customer_reviews.author: JuLee Rudolf

customer_reviews.title: Boo!  Hiss!
customer_reviews.text: Probably the warmest, plushest, comfortable gloves I have ever owned. Tore at the hand seam the first time day I had them and I drove my car with them on. I’m very disappointed now.
customer_reviews.author: Mitchell Priddy

customer_reviews.title: Review for the Black and Yellow gloves.
customer_reviews.text: These gloves are so comfortable! Very cushioney and soft, they just feel good when you put them on. Insulation is good down to about 15 degrees Fahrenheit, but below that your hands start to get cold. The suede palms are super soft and supple. These are listed as work gloves, but these gloves really would not hold up to any kind of outdoor winter work; the materials are just not sturdy enough for that. They are perfect for walking the dog, or running errands in the winter. I ordered the XXL as I have large hands (9 1/2 inches around the palm, 7 3/4 inches from tip of middle finger to heel of palm) and they fit perfectly.
customer_reviews.author: Alakar

customer_reviews.title: Useless gloves ! DO NOT BUY ! Doesn't work even in 0 degrees Celsius.
customer_reviews.text: I have been using this for the last 1 month at West Lafayette. But when u wear this and walk and road, your hands get cold Immediately with in 45 seconds to 1 minute. This product is not at all preferred for long walks and not even for shorter walks like from your office to bus terminal. Only suitable while driving or just to move from parking garage to house etc. So not buying this product will be the best decision!
customer_reviews.author: HJ_Potter_96

customer_reviews.title: Best ever!
customer_reviews.text: These are very very comfortable. It’s been pretty cold here, with wind chills as low as -20f. These gloves are the best. Soft, warm, flexible. Yes your hands will begin to go numb if you’re out in -20f weather, but they will stay warmer longer with these gloves. Best I’ve ever bought. Not meant as work gloves, more “dressy” than that. Highly recommend!
customer_reviews.author: Tyler George

customer_reviews.title: Finally! A pair of gloves that actually fit!
customer_reviews.text: The women's version of these gloves didn't come in a size that would fit, so I looked at the men's gloves. I purchased a pair of mediums and crossed my fingers that they would fit. Usually gloves are way too loose, but these fit like ... gloves! The finger length is perfect and so is the width across the knuckles. I use elbow crutches when walking for exercise and these are thin enough not to interfere with the ergonomic grips. I'm happy.
customer_reviews.author: Desert Rat

customer_reviews.title: Feels nice but poor stitching quality.
customer_reviews.text: While these gloves were very comfortable their durability is questionable. I only wore them two times for less than an hour doing light outdoor tasks and one finger stated tearing at the seam. Wore them one more time and the seam is open about an inch. It's just the outer lining but still loses its insulation ability. They do look nice and fit well but what is a ripped glove worth?...
customer_reviews.author: Brent

customer_reviews.title: Quality non-moisture-resistive gloves for everyday use
customer_reviews.text: For the past two Winters, I've been suffering from cold-hand or Raynaud's syndrome, in which the hands turn blue then white and numb. I've tried heated gloves, which help, but do not warm the finger tips. I ordered a pair of $70 gloves made of Goretex: the gloves kept my palms warm, but not the fingers, and there was little room for flexibility. These gloves, while NOT moisture resistive, keep even my finger-tips fairly warm, warm enough. I have to say that, overall, these have been the best solution so far. Soft, warm, and flexible, for dry weather conditions. Would recommend.
customer_reviews.author: CR Mainwearing

customer_reviews.title: Tested them in a 8 mile hike. 16 degrees and snowing
customer_reviews.text: My last hike in 30 degree weather in Vagina at Christmas I learned I needed better gloves to keep my hands warm than the ones I had. After some review I picked Skydeer driving winter gloves. I picked the right glove! Spent 5 hours in 16 degree snowy weather hiking in North Georgia this weekend and the cold hands issue is history. Great glove great feel and I am very pleased I picked Skydeer.
customer_reviews.author: Randall Hogg

customer_reviews.title: Great news/less great news
customer_reviews.text: I believe this pair of gloves is the best on the market. They are superior in every aspect. I could not be happier EXCEPT for one thing. I ordered a pair of Medium and turns out they are very small on my hands. I can use them but regret not getting a size larger. I read the reviews and agree with the product comments. I looked at the sizing instructions and reviews. The issue I have is of my own doing. It is NOT a negative on the product per se or the seller. Just wish I had a do over. Highly recommend if you are sure of the size you are buying. Thanks!
customer_reviews.author: Bill

customer_reviews.title: decent but not great
customer_reviews.text: These are good for driving and keeping your hands warm. However they are not meant to be work gloves or to be worn when its very cold out. They are not wind proof. Use them to walk my dog and fingers were frozen. They also ripped quite easily as seen in the pic. They were inexpensive so it's not too big of a deal but I won't buy these again.
customer_reviews.author: Journbon

customer_reviews.title: Warm and comfortable!
customer_reviews.text: Fantastic Gloves! If you are on the cusp between two sizes, order down! The gloves are warm, but I was right on the small side of a large, and the gloves were kinda loose whereas if I got a medium, I believe I could have stretched into them and eventually they'd stretch to a perfect fit. EDIT: lost the gloves, so I can't give any more updates on how they're holding up, but they performed well for the one month I had them! I would happily buy from Skydeere again. Maybe next time you guys make it so I can use my phone with them on ;)
customer_reviews.author: David K.

customer_reviews.title: Better than nothing...
customer_reviews.text: These super-breathable gloves are warmish but wimpy. They absorb water like a sponge (hardly what you want when your hands are cold) so they can only be used in guaranteed-dry circumstances. I wear them in the car during my pre-dawn commute to work. They’re useful there, but otherwise require far more pampering than any other pair of gloves I own or have owned. There are so many better selections out there, which is why I rate these below average.
customer_reviews.author: LingoSlinger

customer_reviews.title: Wonderful, Comfortable Gloves for warmth and driving
customer_reviews.text: Initially, I ordered a size medium glove based on some of the reviews of this product that stated that the gloves ran small. It wasn't the case for me. I'm a woman who wears size small gloves. So, I then ordered the small; however, it also turned out to be too, too large. The fingertips of the glove were about an inch longer than desired. I'm disappointed, as I've been trying to find warm gloves in size small that enable the user to drive. These SKYDEER gloves are of the proper material for grasping and holding on to the steering wheel. They also feel wonderful. They just run too large, presumably because they are unisex gloves.
customer_reviews.author: Mrs. Mac

customer_reviews.title: Order a tad larger than you might need.
customer_reviews.text: These gloves are very warm, and comfortable. I have large hands and usually XL fits me just fine. I ordered XL and got XL, and they fit, but are a tiny bit tight. It could be that with wear they will stretch out a bit, I am not sure. I love these gloves and will keep them. I would suggest that if you hands are on the larger side of your size range, then you might want to get the next size up. When they are cold they still allow you to grip your steering wheel without the wheel slipping out of your hands. These gloves are excellent. UPDATE: They did relax a bit and fit perfectly :)
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Great gloves for the price
customer_reviews.text: I bought these glove to use in my car during cold weather. For that, they are great. The gloves fit me extremely well, are comfortable, and very well made. I also use them to wear while scraping snow off of my car. The biggest drawback to these gloves is that they are not very windproof. While doing some limited outdoors work on a windy day, I could feel the wind cut through the gloves. If you're looking for a pair of gloves to sue outdoors, or while skiing, these probably aren't it. But just to keep you hands warm while driving, they are great. For the price they are excellent.
customer_reviews.author: Johnny Carter

customer_reviews.title: SIZED SMALL!!
customer_reviews.text: I'm glad I read the reviews and ordered these in XL, even though that's bigger than I'd buy normally. They are comfortable and seem warm, but even though my hands aren't that big (but have long fingers), the largest size just did fit.
customer_reviews.author: Chief Cynic In Charge

customer_reviews.title: Great gloves but order a size larger
customer_reviews.text: I initially went by the sizing chart and bought Large, since my hands barely measure 9" around. They technically 'fit' but were real snug and a bit uncomfortable. So I took the advice of other reviewers and returned them for X-Large and I'm glad I did. Super comfortable and bound to be much warmer since they're not squeezing my fingers the way the Large did. SKYDEERE should save a lot of returns and encourage people to buy "a size up". Regardless, they are very comfortable and great driving gloves.
customer_reviews.author: STR8Scoop

customer_reviews.title: BEST GLOVE
customer_reviews.text: These are perfect ! Warm yet not too heavy, not too tight around fingers or top of hand - but a nice secure feel. Very soft with a great grip. Snug around the wrist too keep the cold air out. I've worn these in 19 degree weather and my hands were nice and warm. And the best part - the low low price. I couldn't be happier ! Truly the best glove I've ever bought .
customer_reviews.author: Michael

customer_reviews.title: Good for moderate cold
customer_reviews.text: These gloves are a good deal for the price. I live in the NYC area, where the temperature cam get down into the single digits and wind chills can be well below zero. The gloves keep my hands from freezing, but they do feel a little bit chilly when the temperature gets down into the teens or lower. The gloves are comfortable, and they seem well-made. I was confused by the sizing chart, since my hand circumference indicated one size and my finger length indicated another. I ended up ordering a size that was too big, and I had to return them and order the next smaller size, which fit perfectly.
customer_reviews.author: Some random guy

customer_reviews.title: Great... with a BUT
customer_reviews.text: These are very comfortable and well made. Size is perfect as per chart. Can't say how warm because I haven't used them in freezing weather yet. The "but" is that they are only 35% deerskin (palms and inside surface of fingers), so the advertising could be a little misleading . Also 65% polyester, with lining 50% olefin and 50% polyester. However, for the modest price I think they're a good deal.
customer_reviews.author: pha73

customer_reviews.title: Great warm gloves
customer_reviews.text: These gloves are very warm and blocks the wind and freezing temps effectively. More importantly, the suede side is great for gripping the steering wheel when driving. I am a woman and the comparable gloves in the women sizes were sold out so I took a chance and ordered a medium in men’s size (the small was sold out). While the fingers are a tad long, the overall fit is great and I could not be happier with the purchase. The black color also looks good with my coat.
customer_reviews.author: Mrs. Lyons

customer_reviews.title: Mfg Tag says 35% Deerskin & 65% Polyester while marketing line says Deerskin Suede Leather!!
customer_reviews.text: Not quite as described in their lead line! Done on purpose, I think. The first thing they say is WARM SOFT DEERSKIN ...!!!! It even comes with a nice big square paper tag that says DEERSKIN on it. But the inside manufacturer's tag says: 35% Deerskin, 65% Polyester for the Shell; Lining= 50% Olefin & 50% Polyester! Clever marketing...They should print the true content as the lead & let the customer decide if they want this .....
customer_reviews.author: Topper

customer_reviews.title: Not Made for Women
customer_reviews.text: These are very nice gloves but only for men. I was trying to get myself a warm pair of gloves for this winter. I thought these were for women. I wear a Large in women's gloves. No these were a large in men's gloves. So I've decided to give them as a Christmas present rather than sending them back. I reordered another pair in Medium that I thought might fit, No they were too large also. Too long in the fingers and too broad across my hand. I am So Disappointed!! They are really nice, seem to be quite warm and made well. They just aren't for Women!
customer_reviews.author: KatH

customer_reviews.title: Suitable for bike riding at 45 degrees and above
customer_reviews.text: I bought these gloves to use when riding my recumbent trike. They are very comfortable, and worked quite well at keeping my hands & fingers warm until the temperatures dipped below 43 degrees. Please remember that I am riding at 15 MPH with hands exposed and riding for 2 hours. And even though my fingers got cold, they never felt too cold. Like others have mentioned, I would recommend getting one size larger than the fit guide suggests. The gloves seem to be well made and attractive.
customer_reviews.author: Mike B.

customer_reviews.title: Soft and comfortable. Fingers might be narrow for big guys
customer_reviews.text: I'm very happy with the gloves, and the price is a good balance with the quality. It's a "fleece" material, very good, not great. I'm 6'ft 175 lbs, I have longer, narrow hands - the glove are just a little short and tight in the fingers, but just a little - not a deal killer. If you have beefy hands I don't think this will work for you. They'll be plenty warm for my most winter days, maybe down into the 20s F. Won't be warm enough for extended outdoor activity. Photo in listing is accurate. Would have been 5 stars if cut had been a little more generous.
customer_reviews.author: SilverDollar

customer_reviews.title: Nice and warm!
customer_reviews.text: I have really enjoyed these gloves! I walk the dog every night in 25 degree weather and they stay nice and warm.
customer_reviews.author: Travis Irvine

customer_reviews.title: Comfortable mid-cold climate gloves
customer_reviews.text: First of all, the gloves fit well. They're comfortable and do a decent job of keeping out the cold. HOWEVER, they do get wet if you're snowblowing or doing any activity in the snow... they're not great for real cold or wet climates... they're pretty average but comfortable. Ideally they'd be better waterproofed perhaps with a silicone spray or something.... but I will use them in my vehicle in the winter as an "extra pair" or for casual use. They're just not that warm when you're shoveling or snow blowing outside for any period of time.
customer_reviews.author: D. Crawford

customer_reviews.title: Favorite Gloves
customer_reviews.text: Best gloves for the money that I have come across. I have very harsh winters where I live and they work well for keeping my hands warm and aren't to bulky or stiff. Some of the insulation/ padding comes out over time, but once that happens.. I just use them for other tasks. Use an old pair for working out and have even used a pair for roofing and their durability was far better than any other gloves I used.
customer_reviews.author: Joseph A. Mcmullin

customer_reviews.title: Feels and looks like fleece not leather
customer_reviews.text: My hands were numb after 30 minutes in 26 degree temps. The gloves have no leather or deerskin feel at all. They feel like cotton fleece. The company asked me if I was satisfied and I told them no. They said the palm was deerskin but it feels like fleece. I bought these based on the positive reviews and the low price but I wanted a warm glove for low winter temps. Thinking of returning them...
customer_reviews.author: John Spencer

customer_reviews.title: Don't waste your money
customer_reviews.text: If I could rate this product a zero that's what it would be. These gloves are a waste of money and they do not keep your hands warm. I live in the mid west and it gets extremely cold here. So I trusted the reviews I read. I do not know where these people live but I will say they lied. Save your money and go to the dollar store and get a pair of gloves. They will keep your hands warmer than these.
customer_reviews.author: Jacqueline B.

customer_reviews.title: Good gloves!
customer_reviews.text: Wore them in Jackson Hole WY this winter for a week. They're not water proof but they held up well around town even considering some wet snow towards the end of the week. Forty (yes 40+) plus inches of snow from a winter storm while we were there! Wore them every day except the day we went skiing. Put them in my coat pocket while indoors and let them dry off at night. Teens and early twenties for the first part of the week and warmed up to 33 before we left. They kept my hands warm so no complaints!
customer_reviews.author: Michael EMC

customer_reviews.title: Great gloves
customer_reviews.text: I don't know about the touch screen--didn't try that--but I needed a new pair of gloves for an unexpected trip to Alaska in the spring, and these worked fine. Wouldn't be good for really cold weather, but I walked around at the ice festival outside for about 1.5 hours and my hands didn't get cold. The temp. was around 20. I don't think they'd be warm enough for much colder than that though--my hands were cold when it was closer to around 10. But they're soft and served my purposes well!
customer_reviews.author: Desert Mambo

customer_reviews.title: Great deal, quality gloves! Order one size up.
customer_reviews.text: I love these gloves, they’re warm and comfortable and they don’t slide around when you’re gripping a snow shovel or other tools. And at a VERY reasonable price. Hard to find anything of this quality for less than $20. I agree with the other reviewers who say order one size up, they do run a little small. I’m a large in Lands End gloves, and I ordered XL in these and they fit well.
customer_reviews.author: D. Jennings

customer_reviews.title: Nice warm glove.
customer_reviews.text: I have average size hands with long fingers and I found the large size to fit well with a little bit of space at the tips, the glove fits my palm well. The fabric feels like a thick felt and is slightly stiff, they softened up after a couple of days. The thinsulate makes them very warm, my fingers feel as warm and my palm. For the price its a good glove for dry winter weather.
customer_reviews.author: The Bruce

customer_reviews.title: Decent gloves for warmth, not as a work glove.
customer_reviews.text: I got these for working in a freezer at a store moving boxes and groceries around. Only a week in, the gloves started to fall apart by the fingers. Warmth wise, they were good. At -3 they was good enough for a hour or two. Can't say for how water resistant they were due to mine falling apart and then they got wet. Ruined my whole day, frozen solid almost.
customer_reviews.author: BP Productions

customer_reviews.title: Soft, warm and flexible
customer_reviews.text: Don't overthink these - just get them. They are just right for cool/cold weather. They are the perfect cost to comfort ratio. These are good quality and clearly a good value. They have a solid feel and are very soft. They are obviously NOT meant to work in the rain or snow as they are soft fleece and not waterproof. Clearing frost or snow from a car = OK, but not much more. They also dry fast!
customer_reviews.author: Dan G.

customer_reviews.title: Hubby's Favorite Gloves
customer_reviews.text: I purchased this item for my husband to wear on cold or rainy days when he walks our dog. He claims they're the best and warmest gloves he's had! The best part? They are so well made and so reasonably priced. Very happy.
customer_reviews.author: Sassy Granny

customer_reviews.title: Very good gloves. Kept my hands very warm while shoveling ...
customer_reviews.text: Very good gloves. Kept my hands very warm while shoveling snow at 10 degrees F with a breeze. Based on what other reviews said, I bought a size larger than the sizing chart. The chart indicated I should get a large. I bought extra large and they fit well. Just a bit loose which is how I like winter gloves to fit. Only been wearing them for a week, but they seem durable enough for casual wear and light work. Not too bulky so they fit in my coat pocket. Definitely worth it for the price of $13.99.
customer_reviews.author: BeanSprout

customer_reviews.title: Not very warm
customer_reviews.text: They are not very warm. My fingers started getting cold after only a minute. Not a good cold weather glove.
customer_reviews.author: Harold R. Sargent

customer_reviews.title: Not as good as I would have expected
customer_reviews.text: Given the product description and prior reviews, I'd expected a warmer, sturdier product. However, the gloves were not as warm as I would have thought. Moreover, the stitching on one glove separated on the very first day of (very limited) use. Lastly, the clip to keep the gloves together when not in use is balky, small, and difficult to use.
customer_reviews.author: Ben Skove

customer_reviews.title: Very good.
customer_reviews.text: I love these gloves, I do not know why they are thought to work on a touch screen though, in my car they don't do anything to my screen. I take the gloves off to do anything. For cleaning off the car, I have had not problems with water getting in, although they do seem to stay a little wetter longer then my old pair of gloves. For comfort though, they are near the best gloves I have ever worn.
customer_reviews.author: Frank Warmsley III

customer_reviews.title: Nice comfortable gloves !
customer_reviews.text: Couldn't find my gloves from last year so ordered these... Since then I have found 2 sets of gloves, but these are so comfortable and warm I always wear them... You will be very happy with them !
customer_reviews.author: David J. Kain

customer_reviews.title: Your gloves do indeed keep my hands warm!
customer_reviews.text: I have neuropathy in my hands so I have a lot of nerve pain. My hands burn so bad when it's cold so I have to put gloves on before I even go outside. However, once outside with my old gloves on, the burning begins. I just received my new gloves about a week ago and our temperature dropped to 24° so I grabbed my Skydeer gloves and out the door I went... I had NO burning in my hands whatsoever!! I couldn't believe it!! Thank you so much for your product! I truly am very happy I purchased them!
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: very comfortable  Gloves !
customer_reviews.text: These gloves are too comfortable and warm have been a great help to withstand the low temperatures since my hands cool very easily and recovering the temperature is difficult, but with these incredible gloves I found a great relief, I obtained them at a very good price I adore its material and its good grip also my fingers move without problem when I wear them I have used them to do jobs outside my house jobs with tools and they passed the tests, I really recommend them for their quality and good price I think I'll order another pair of these gloves for my father I know that the conditions outside in the cold will also improve a lot.
customer_reviews.author: AGFER

customer_reviews.title: no wind situation, comfort
customer_reviews.text: 1. use in a relative still air situation. When biking with it, you will feel cord. 2. not too cood here, about-10° centigrade or above is sure provided 1 is satisfied. 3. Just ignore its touch screen function. It does has this function only effect one after you temp 10 times. 4. feels very comfort,
customer_reviews.author: littlezeros

customer_reviews.title: A bit on the cold side!
customer_reviews.text: The gloves fits as expected. Looks to be well made. I tried them for the first time this morning for a walk with the dog. It was 6° with a light breeze. My fingers started getting cold after a half hour, I'm usually out longer than that. I realize that gloves are not as warm as mittens, but I wanted to give these a true test. They are going to be fine in a bit warmer temps.
customer_reviews.author: NRC

customer_reviews.title: Great pair of inexpensive gloves.
customer_reviews.text: These gloves are exactly what I needed. I wanted a driving glove for the single digit temps that are taking place. They keep my hands warm and have a nice grip on my steering wheel. The quality seems great and the fit is nice and snug. My only complaint would be the overall size of the glove just a tad too big, but that would be the price you pay for warmth. Would buy these again!
customer_reviews.author: Pen Name

customer_reviews.title: No meant for "real" winter conditions.
customer_reviews.text: Not for real winter conditions. Nice and soft and fit well, but at -3 F, with liners on as well, I managed to suffer grade 0 and 1 frostbite on 2 fingers. Definitely can't see using these over our long Alaskan winters when we just started to hit negatives. Will return these.
customer_reviews.author: Edward J. Gonzalez

customer_reviews.title: Cheap warm and comfortable.
customer_reviews.text: For the price I think these are great. I've been buying $50+ gloves for years, but these seem to do just as well. I could see them wearing out quicker, but usually I'll lose one so for like 15 bucks these are perfect. I use mine for driving in cold Missouri mornings and going for walks. They have kept me warm and comfortable well down into the single digits.
customer_reviews.author: josh

customer_reviews.title: Not built for winter
customer_reviews.text: It advertises like it can keep your hands warm while skiing in the snow - but not for me. At 20f temps my fingers are freezing, and I have to take them off to get my hands warm again. It's nice for protecting against cold wind I guess, only as long as it's around 40f and above.
customer_reviews.author: Joshua

customer_reviews.title: Warm, Comfortable Gloves
customer_reviews.text: First, I have not tried to use a touch screen with these gloves, and I have not immersed them in water. Those two issues aside, these gloves fit perfectly. They are very warm, and they are incredibly comfortable. They have exceeded my expectations. If I should lose one or both for any reason, I will absolutely buy another pair. I could not be more satisfied with this purchase.
customer_reviews.author: Lloyd M. Hulit

customer_reviews.title: Nice gloves at a nice price
customer_reviews.text: I was looking for some decent winter gloves that were indeed warm (I'm in NE USA, close to the Canadian border) that wouldn't break the bank. These fit the bill. They are comfortable, warm, and nice-looking at a fair price. After putting them through their paces shoveling and snowblowing during and after our latest snow storm(s) in sub-freezing temps, I'm quite satisfied with my choice.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Mostly Very Good
customer_reviews.text: Haven't yet had any really cold weather where I am but in temps into the mid 20s, the gloves are sufficient for being outdoors about an hour. My only cavil is the little clip used to hook the gloves together when not on your hands is way too small and way too stiff.
customer_reviews.author: Gary E. Osius

customer_reviews.title: Fine gloves if they fit your needs
customer_reviews.text: They seem to be fine gloves. Look good. Fit well. They seem to be warm, but warmer weather has held up in my neck of the woods. While I have nothing negative to say about these, I do wonder why in this day and age that all gloves don't have touch screen capabilities. I also wonder why I bought gloves without that feature?! But if you don't mind taking them off a lot to deal with your phone, they're fine.
customer_reviews.author: Bill

customer_reviews.title: They Don't Keep My Hands Warm at 43 Degrees
customer_reviews.text: I finally had an opportunity to use these gloves. It got down to 43 degrees this morning for my walk with my dogs. Before I reach the 3rd house in my neighborhood, I felt the cold coming in, chilling my fingers. They were almost no good.
customer_reviews.author: Soundman Art

customer_reviews.title: There are better
customer_reviews.text: Not warm. If you tend to wear your glove between 40 and 50 degrees these might be OK. Half hour walk at 40 and my hands were cold.
customer_reviews.author: tonermd

customer_reviews.title: Good, Warm Gloves for the Price
customer_reviews.text: I had been putting up with gloves that didn’t keep my hands warm on walks. When I read these had thinsulate I decided to give them a try. They are very warm, yet light and thin. True size. I bought large. My only reservation is that I thought the palms would be deer skin leather, but if this is deer skin, then i’m a Monkey’s Uncle.
customer_reviews.author: TODMTNS

customer_reviews.title: Awesome gloves
customer_reviews.text: I wish I would’ve found these gloves on Amazon long ago because I’ve wasted time and money at big box stores buying crap gloves. Right out of the box I put these on and knew they were what I had been wanting. Easy on, snug but comfortable fit, warm, soft, flexible. Price is incredible. I’ll be buying more of these soon. Thank you skydeere
customer_reviews.author: fredTLodong

customer_reviews.title: Warm & roughed
customer_reviews.text: I find these to be warm and pretty roughed. Not too good for wet situations. These are my goto winter replacement for leather work gloves. I just use two pair, so one can dry while I'm wearing the other. Holding up very well
customer_reviews.author: tell family

customer_reviews.title: Awesome customer service !
customer_reviews.text: They fit well and are comfortable, I purchased driving gloves but primarily use them when my dog takes me for a walk. I live in new England and they keep my hands sufficiently warm . And I’m very impressed with what I perceive as the company’s effort and follow up With regards to customer service and satisfaction.
customer_reviews.author: Oats

customer_reviews.title: Lightweight and Warm
customer_reviews.text: Just had our first major snow storm of the season and used these the first time. Kept my hands warm while cleaning the snow off the truck and driving while cold. Haven't seen temps below 20 yet, but for 20-30, they did fine.
customer_reviews.author: Ribs & Blues

customer_reviews.title: Great
customer_reviews.text: Great product. I wearing size L but I order size XL. My thought was right and it fit very well. Recommend order one size bigger. It is very comfortable and keep my hand warm. Love it and ready for the winter!
customer_reviews.author: Andy Pat

customer_reviews.title: Comfortable and warm.
customer_reviews.text: I normally wear an XL glove. These ran fairly true to size, a little large, washed and dried one of the two pairs I bought and shrunk them to a perfect fit. So far, far the only down side is the black die from the palms bleeds out. Wearing as a work glove installing siding and was leaving black smears all over the material.
customer_reviews.author: JPN

customer_reviews.title: Soft but not warm.
customer_reviews.text: I work in a cooler for 12 hour shifts and was looking for a pair of gloves to replace the ones I had. I got these because the others were no longer available. The gloves are soft, comfortable and fit me but they don’t really keep my hands warm while driving a hi lo. It’s better than not having gloves but not by much.
customer_reviews.author: N A K

customer_reviews.title: Warm but not bulky
customer_reviews.text: Husband and son love them! Warm but not too bulky. Soft too!
customer_reviews.author: JNThoe

customer_reviews.title: exceptional fit
customer_reviews.text: For the price, these gloves are superior to most; the fit was excellent. Can't say about whether they could keep your hands warm at temps below the freeze mark. I use them on my GYD shift, and at 40 degrees, my hands, while not very cold were no longer warm, but the protection is still very good. Am sure with heat packs inserted, they would be great. One observation: Most "cold weather" gloves are too bulky to write with. These are the first that enabled me to do report writing while wearing them, a testament as to their flexibility.
customer_reviews.author: Glenn

customer_reviews.title: Warm, comfy, stylish!
customer_reviews.text: I’m happy with them thus far. They are warm and comfortable. They are stylish. I wear them for casual outings, not to work in or to deal with any kind of moisture. If they stand up to wear & tear, I’ll be very pleased.
customer_reviews.author: Chuck

customer_reviews.title: Adequate for what I want in gloves
customer_reviews.text: I bought these gloves to keep in my car's glove compartment. I don't know how many times I've driven off in cold weather without gloves and regretted it. Case solved. These gloves grip well thanks to the deer hide palms. They're warm enough. All in all, no negatives.
customer_reviews.author: JimmySpags

customer_reviews.title: Off gassed a chemical smell for 2 weeks
customer_reviews.text: Great gloves, comfortable. But almost could not get past the smell once they were out of the plastic. They had to stay outside for over 2 weeks to get to the point where I could keep them in the house.
customer_reviews.author: SitkaCedar

customer_reviews.title: Warm and Cozy
customer_reviews.text: I bought one pair for myself and liked them so much that I ordered two more for family members. They liked them too.
customer_reviews.author: Bodie

customer_reviews.title: They are nice and soft and fit well but did not keep ...
customer_reviews.text: bought the gloves to keep me warm shoveling. Last couple times at 20 degrees my fingers got very cold. Put a canvas glove over the top of them and hands stayed warm even when running snow blower. Sorry but not keeping me as warm as I thought they would. They are nice and soft and fit well but did not keep me warm enough for outside shoveling. Just putting on cleaning car off and driving seemed ok
customer_reviews.author: Kindle Customer

customer_reviews.title: Warm, but not great for playing in snow.
customer_reviews.text: Bought these for my son, and ended up using them myself. They are warm and seem well made, but unfortunately when he wore them to play outside had trouble with snow caking the material. They are however perfect for outdoor activities that don't involve making snowballs (shoveling, snowshoeing etc.).
customer_reviews.author: Lisbeth

customer_reviews.title: great for winter outdoor work
customer_reviews.text: I bought these for my brother who has very large hands and works outside a lot- he found these to be warm and comfortable- they don't get stiff or hurt his hands as he is working and they keep his hands warm in these Minnesota winters!! they are well made and an EXCELLENT value!
customer_reviews.author: Mary Kolosky

customer_reviews.title: Happy hubby!
customer_reviews.text: My husband loves these. He said they feel great and actually fit his long fingers. He regularly tears the fingers of his gloves out as they aren't long enough. I will purchase again.
customer_reviews.author: mom4life

customer_reviews.title: These are terrible
customer_reviews.text: I wore these for the first time, and I was outside for about 30 minutes in 31 degree weather. My fingers started to get cold almost immediately, and by the end of my time outside were so cold they hurt. Gloves are worthless if they can't keep the tips of your fingers warm for 30 minutes.
customer_reviews.author: jaileer

customer_reviews.title: Comfy + "grippy"
customer_reviews.text: Nice fit. Overall good construction, although they have started to pill around fingers. Since they are black a lighter fixes that problem quickly. They grip a steering wheel well, maybe even too well with some squeaking. Warm enough, but not for long hikes below 40 degrees.
customer_reviews.author: Tyler

customer_reviews.title: nice looking
customer_reviews.text: I have not had a chance to wear them yet in cold weather, but they look as though they will do the job. Skydeer is a 3M company. The quality seems excellent.
customer_reviews.author: Harold R. Holmyard III

customer_reviews.title: Warm
customer_reviews.text: I bought these gloves for my husband and he loves them. Actually it is his second pair.
customer_reviews.author: Donna Nance

customer_reviews.title: good deal for the buck
customer_reviews.text: the deerskin palms are what make this item worthwhile, allowing you to handle, say, a wooden snow shovel handle without mangling the product. One drawback: they keep my hands warm down to 32F.; anything temperature below that and you wish for either inserts or another sort of glove/mitten
customer_reviews.author: sailor

customer_reviews.title: Awesome!!!
customer_reviews.text: So very, very comfy and warm. I have arthritis in my hands and they sometimes swell...these gloves are large enough that my hands still fit all comfy like inside of them on those days and they are very warm for shoveling snow!
customer_reviews.author: Mombie

customer_reviews.title: A little dissapointed
customer_reviews.text: I ride my bike to work on the coldest days here. I was hoping these would be an upgrade to the 'Target' $15 gloves, but my first ride wearing them left my hands cold and it was 33. I'm pretty disappointed. They look very nice! Just not the protection I had hoped for and promised.
customer_reviews.author: Steve Hickerson

customer_reviews.title: Nice, but the lining in the left glove wasn't held in
customer_reviews.text: Seems like a sewing issue. Right glove is awesome, and warm. Nice to the touch. The left glove has some sort of internal sewing issue that you can feel when you put your hand in, as the fabric wants to pull out with your fingers. Very uncomfortable. Makes the gloves useless. Shame, because they seem rather nice.
customer_reviews.author: James C

customer_reviews.title: Cheap!!
customer_reviews.text: One of those "You get what you pay for" 30 degrees and your hands will be cold wearing these!!
customer_reviews.author: James Helfer

customer_reviews.title: Ran small for me
customer_reviews.text: Size chart said to get a large. I ordered an XL due to my experience of made in China garments being too small. The XL was even too small!
customer_reviews.author: Lochlan LongstriderTop Contributor: Drawing

customer_reviews.title: Warm and comfortable
customer_reviews.text: These gloves look and feel great. I don't have any particular use for them other than keeping hands warm, but they do the job. Just wish they were a little less bulky, kind of have to adjust to picking up things. But the palm side has the deer skin gripping so that helps.
customer_reviews.author: RICHARD CARL HIGHT

customer_reviews.title: Thinsulate warm gloves
customer_reviews.text: These gloves replace a pair of really warm gloves, however, they were very thick and made it hard to do somethings. Even picking up dropped things like money or answering the cell phone nearly impossible without removing them. These gloves can do most things and keep your hands warm at the same time. Gloves stay on outside in the cold, periood
customer_reviews.author: Allen Heil

customer_reviews.title: Decent Gloves
customer_reviews.text: Nice gloves that fit well and look good for a casual wear style. I wear them mostly for walking and find that they are good for above 32 degrees. Below that they are not warm enough but then they are also very inexpensive and I feel good value for what you get. I would buy them again just knowing they won't be for the really cold weather.
customer_reviews.author: BUtraveller

customer_reviews.title: Warm and well made.
customer_reviews.text: I've received these and I'm pleased. They are warm, comfortable, and well made. The sizing chart in one of the product images was helpful and the pair I got fits like an... err... glove.
customer_reviews.author: Jeremy

customer_reviews.title: Very nice gloves!!
customer_reviews.text: I have trouble with my hands when they get cold so I purchased this in hopes that they would be warm. It was a very good decision. These gloves a comfortable and warm AF. They aren't work gloves but just general to keep your hands warm gloves they are highly efficient.
customer_reviews.author: David L. Fields

customer_reviews.title: These are awesome!
customer_reviews.text: I'm a short woman with chubby fingers and a men's small glove is my best fit. I bought these to wear when snowblowing and shoveling in the winter cold, but they are just the right warmth, so I've ended up wearing them all the time! I might buy a second pair just for backup!
customer_reviews.author: A. Singer

customer_reviews.title: Better than I thought they would be
customer_reviews.text: Over the years I've purchased different kinds of gloves for driving when it was cold outside. The did little for me except to keep my hands cold! But these gloves work. Easy to drive with and much more comfortable, making my hands feel warmer, too!
customer_reviews.author: Collectus Magnimus

customer_reviews.title: Very Comfortable and Pliable
customer_reviews.text: Husband says that these gloves are great! They are comfortable, nice for driving, and working in the cold weather. He highly recommends them!
customer_reviews.author: Leed

customer_reviews.title: Keeps hands dry in snow...
customer_reviews.text: As far as fit I have to order XXL gloves for my hands and these fit snugly. But they are warm and keeps my hands wet with scraping ice and snow in the mornings so far. I would recommend these to anyone. They look pretty durable and reasonably priced.
customer_reviews.author: Doc Savage

customer_reviews.title: A Great Pair of Gloves
customer_reviews.text: These gloves do a great job. They protect your hands from the weather. And they are very comfortable. I like them so much that I bought a second pair.
customer_reviews.author: Tom D

product_meta.title: SKYDEER Winter Glove - Premium Genuine Soft Deerskin Suede Leather and Polar Fleece Glove, with 3M Thinsulate Insulation Suitable for Outdoor Sport and Keep Warm in Cold Weather (Unisex Gray Large)
feature_bullets: Premium Genuine Deerskin Suede Leather / Warm Polar Fleece / 3M Thinsulate™ Insulation

Premium Genuine Deerskin Leather Suede is naturally soft and flexible, with moderate abrasion resistance. And the polar fleece back is windproof, comfort and warmth. All materials are skin friendly and moisture wicking layers inside keeps your hands sweat free.

3M Thinsulate Insulation protects your hands while you're out working in cold temperatures.It helps trap hands heat, while allowing moisture to escape. Keep the hand temperature to the maximum extent possible.
Double shirred elastic wrist keeps the glove closed around your skin and keeps dirt, debris, snow and cold wind out in winter outdoor sports. Keep your hands warm as much as possible.

Suitable for Outdoor Casual & Clothing Collocation & Work. Premium genuine deerskin suede glove is very beautiful, comfortable and high grade. Perfect for cold winter casual, riding, driver, hiking, running, bicycling, hoveling snow, landscaping, DIY projects, Cross-Country skiing, snowmobile and other winter outdoor activities.
100% money back guarantee: your gloves are backed by our unconditional 90 day guarantee. Order now with confidence.

specifications.Material: Premium Genuine Deerskin Suede / Warm Polar Fleece
specifications.Special Features: Super Warm and Soft in Cold Weather
specifications.Usage: Keep Warm in Extra Cold Weather
